drug.name: Ditiocarb Zinc
drug.description:
Ditiocarb Zinc, also known as Diethyldithiocarbamic acid zinc salt, is a known chelator for copper and zinc. It also a dermatological sensitizer and allergen.
Sensitivity to Ditiocarb Zinc may be identified with a clinical patch test.
drug.indication: Ditiocarb Zinc is approved for use within allergenic epicutaneous patch tests which are indicated for use as an aid in the diagnosis of allergic contact dermatitis (ACD) in persons 6 years of age and older.

product.name: T.R.U.E. Test Thin-Layer Rapid Use Patch Test

mixture.name: T.R.U.E. Test Thin-Layer Rapid Use Patch Test
mixture.ingredients: 2-mercaptobenzothiazole + 2,2'-Dibenzothiazyl disulfide + 4-(Isopropylamino)diphenylamine + alpha-Amyl cinnamaldehyde + Bacitracin + Balsam of Peru + Benzocaine + Benzylparaben + Bisphenol A diglycidyl ether + Bromothalonil + Bronopol + Budesonide + Butylparaben + Chlorquinaldol + Cinchocaine + Cinnamaldehyde + Cinnamyl alcohol + Clioquinol + Cobalt chloride + Diazolidinylurea + Dichromate + Dipentamethylenethiuram disulfide + Diphenylguanidine + Disperse Blue 106 + Disulfiram + Ditiocarb Zinc + Ethyl hydroxybenzoate + Ethylenediamine + Eugenol + Evernia prunastri + Formaldehyde + Geraniol + Hydrocortisone butyrate + Hydroxycitronellal + Imidurea + Isoeugenol + Lanolin alcohols + Methylchloroisothiazolinone + Methylparaben + Morpholinylmercaptobenzothiazole + N-Cyclohexyl-N'-phenyl-1,4-phenylenediamine + N,N'-diphenyl-1,4-phenylenediamine + Neomycin + Nickel sulfate + p-Phenylenediamine + P-Tert-Butylphenol-Formaldehyde Resin (Low Molecular Weight) + Parthenolide + Propylparaben + Quaternium-15 + Rosin + Sodium aurotiosulfate + Tetracaine + Tetramethylthiuram monosulfide + Thimerosal + Thiohexam + Thiram + Tixocortol + Zinc Dibutyldithiocarbamate

category.category: Agents for Treatment of Hemorrhoids and Anal Fissures for Topical Use
Compounds used in a research, industrial, or household setting

atc-code.level: Other agents for treatment of hemorrhoids and anal fissures for topical use
AGENTS FOR TREATMENT OF HEMORRHOIDS AND ANAL FISSURES FOR TOPICAL USE

drug-interaction.name: Ursodeoxycholic acid
drug-interaction.description: Ditiocarb Zinc can cause a decrease in the absorption of Ursodeoxycholic acid resulting in a reduced serum concentration and potentially a decrease in efficacy.
